title.narrative: Structuring of an International Network of Solar Technology and Application Resource Centres

description.narrative: The present project document operationalizes the collaboration between the International Solar Alliance (ISA) and the United Nations Industrial Development Organisation (UNIDO) to establish the International Network of Solar Technology Application and Resource Centres (STAR-C) with financial support of the Government of France, materialized through an agreement between ISA and the Ministry of Europe and Foreign Affairs of France in representation of the Government of France. This STAR C contributes to increased access of ISA Member States, particularly in least developed countries (LDCs) and small island developing states (SIDS), to quality solar products and services for inclusive and sustainable development. The initiative will do a positive impact on market uptake paving the way by strengthening quality infrastructure and standards for PV and solar thermal products and services, the creation and reinforcement of local capacities in technological areas to provide certified solar curricula and training, as well as the strengthening of solar networks and knowledge management with support of key stakeholders with presence and experience in priority areas.
